column1: Nam Định (listen) is a city in the Red River Delta of northern Vietnam. It is the capital of Nam Định Province. The city of Nam Định is 90 km south-east of Vietnam's capital
column2: Hanoi. From August 18–20 of each year
column3: there is a festival held in Nam Định called the Cố Trạch. This celebration honors General Trần Hưng Đạo
column4: a 13th-century national hero who led Vietnamese forces to victory over the invading Mongols. Nam Định (actually
column5: the village of Trà Lũ) is also the birthplace of Letran Student
column6: Dominican Friar and Vietnamese Saint Vicente Liem de la Paz
column7: O.P. De la Paz was canonized by Pope John Paul II on June 19

column1: Nam Định has two sports facilities
column2: Thiên Trường Stadium (formerly Cuối Stadium) and Trần Quốc Toản Indoor Stadium
column3: which are host to football and volleyball matches. Both sports centers are located on Hùng Vương Street.

column1: Hà Nam Ninh was the National Football Champions (V.League) in 1985 with star player Nguyễn Văn Dũng. In 2001
column2: Nam Định took second place in the National Championships
column3: losing to Bình Định F.C. In 2007
column4: the Nam Định football team changed its name to Đạm Phú Mỹ Nam Định and won its first National Cup under its new name. In 2009 the Nam Định Football team changed its name to Megastar Nam Định F.C and failed in standing on V-League to 1st level tournament 2010.
